text:
Giovanni "Tinto" Brass (born 26 March 1933) is an Italian movie director, producer and screenwriter. He was born in Milan, Italy.
In the 1960s and 1970s, he directed many avant-garde movies. He is known for his movies "Caligula", "Così fan tutte" (released under the English title "All Ladies Do It"), "Paprika", "Monella" ("Frivolous Lola") and "Trasgredire".
In April 2010, Brass was hospitalized after having an intracranial hemorrhage.
